scenarioDescription:
The HAT-P-40 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HAT-P-40 is a star with 1.03 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.94 times its radius. It is located 1514.89 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 2.7 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HAT-P-40 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HAT-P-40 system


HAT-P-40 b

HAT-P-40 b was discovered by the HATNet observatory, in 2012-11, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HAT-P-40 b is 152.640 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HAT-P-40 b is 17.038 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HAT-P-40 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HAT-P-40, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the HATNet.
name: HAT-P-40 - System With 1 Exoplanet
